description.para: These getters allow for easy string-to-enumeration-value conversion.

briefdescription.para: Converts the given string to a wxArchitecture enum value or to wxARCH_INVALID if the given string is not a valid architecture string (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: does not contain nor 32 nor 64 strings).

briefdescription.para: Converts the given string to a wxEndianness enum value or to wxENDIAN_INVALID if the given string is not a valid endianness string (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: does not contain nor little nor big strings).

briefdescription.para: Converts the given string to a wxOperatingSystemId enum value or to wxOS_UNKNOWN if the given string is not a valid operating system name.

Converts the given string to a wxWidgets port ID value or to wxPORT_UNKNOWN if the given string does not match any of the wxWidgets canonical name ports ("wxGTK", "wxMSW", etc) nor any of the short wxWidgets name ports ("gtk", "msw", etc).

description.para: These getters allow for easy enumeration-value-to-string conversion.

briefdescription.para: Returns the name for the given wxArchitecture enumeration value.
Returns name for the given wxEndianness enumeration value.

Returns the operating system family name for the given wxOperatingSystemId enumeration value: Unix for wxOS_UNIX, Macintosh for wxOS_MAC, Windows for wxOS_WINDOWS, DOS for wxOS_DOS, OS/2 for wxOS_OS2.
Returns the name for the given operating system ID value.

detaileddescription.para: This can be a long name (e.g. Microsoft Windows NT); use GetOperatingSystemFamilyName() to retrieve a short, generic name.

briefdescription.para: Returns the name of the given wxWidgets port ID value.

detaileddescription.para: The usingUniversal argument specifies whether the port is in its native or wxUniversal variant.
The returned string always starts with the "wx" prefix and is a mixed-case string.

briefdescription.para: Returns the short name of the given wxWidgets port ID value.

detaileddescription.para: The usingUniversal argument specifies whether the port is in its native or wxUniversal variant.
The returned string does not start with the "wx" prefix and is always lower case.

briefdescription.para: Returns the operating system directory.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGetOSDirectory() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the architecture ID of this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the endianness ID of this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the run-time major version of the OS associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the run-time minor version of the OS associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the operating system ID of this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGetOsVersion() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the description of the operating system of this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGetOSDescription() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the wxWidgets port ID associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the Linux distribution info associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGetLinuxDistributionInfo() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the desktop environment associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: See wxAppTraits::GetDesktopEnvironment() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the run-time major version of the toolkit associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: Note that if GetPortId() returns wxPORT_BASE, then this value is zero (unless externally modified with SetToolkitVersion()); that is, no native toolkit is in use. See wxAppTraits::GetToolkitVersion() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the run-time minor version of the toolkit associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.

detaileddescription.para: Note that if GetPortId() returns wxPORT_BASE, then this value is zero (unless externally modified with SetToolkitVersion()); that is, no native toolkit is in use. See wxAppTraits::GetToolkitVersion() for more info.

briefdescription.para: Returns the name for the architecture of this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the name for the endianness of this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the operating system family name of the OS associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the operating system name of the OS associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the name of the wxWidgets port ID associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Returns the short name of the wxWidgets port ID associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the architecture enum value associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the endianness enum value associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the version of the operating system associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the operating system associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the wxWidgets port ID associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the version of the toolkit associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the operating system description associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the desktop environment associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Sets the linux distribution info associated with this wxPlatformInfo instance.
Initializes the instance with the values corresponding to the currently running platform.

detaileddescription.para: This is a fast operation because it only requires to copy the values internally cached for the currently running platform.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxPortId pid, int tkMajor=-1, int tkMinor=-1, wxOperatingSystemId id=wxOS_UNKNOWN, int osMajor=-1, int osMinor=-1, wxArchitecture arch=wxARCH_INVALID, wxEndianness endian=wxENDIAN_INVALID)
memberdef.name: wxPlatformInfo

briefdescription.para: Initializes the object using given values.
Returns true if the OS version is at least major.minor.
Returns true if the toolkit version is at least major.minor.
Returns true if this instance is fully initialized with valid values.
Returns true if this wxPlatformInfo describes wxUniversal build.
Inequality operator.

detaileddescription.para: Tests all class' internal variables.

briefdescription.para: Equality operator.

detaileddescription.para: Tests all class' internal variables.

briefdescription.para: Returns the global wxPlatformInfo object, initialized with the values for the currently running platform.
This class holds informations about the operating system, the toolkit and the basic architecture of the machine where the application is currently running.

detaileddescription.para: This class does not only have getters for the informations above, it also has setters. This allows you to e.g. save the current platform informations in a data file (maybe in string form) so that when you later load it, you can easily retrieve (see the static getters for string->enum conversion functions) and store inside a wxPlatformInfo instance (using its setters) the signature of the system which generated it.

In general however you only need to use the static Get() function and then access the various informations for the current platform: wxLogMessage("Thisapplicationisrunningunder%s.", wxPlatformInfo::Get().GetOperatingSystemIdName());
Library:wxBase
Category:Application and System configuration

simplesect.para: wxGetOsVersion(), wxIsPlatformLittleEndian(), wxIsPlatform64Bit(), wxAppTraits, Network, User and OS
